intro: Euphrasia odontites var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive serrated edge, while its stems are upright and branching. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
